interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/07/12
Average Rating: 3.9
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Fedor Bondarchuk'], 'Producers': ['Fedor Bondarchuk', 'Aleksandr Andryushchenko', 'Michael Kitaev', 'Elena Nelidova', 'Dmitriy Rudovskiy', 'Alina Tyazhlova', 'Mikhail Vrubel', 'Anton Zlatopolskiy'], 'Starring': ['Irina Starshenbaum', 'Alexander Petrov', 'Rinal Mukhametov'], 'Studio': ['Dark Sky Films']}
Review Text: Already re-gurgitated alien invasion genre & theme flogged to death. Sleep induced script & snail mail delivered acting topped off with shit tiered english delivery by a cast of unknowns.  CGI efx cannot save this steamy pile of excrement.
Review Title: another sci fi turdfest
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['D.J. Caruso'], 'Producers': ['Joe Roth', 'Jeff Kirschenbaum', 'Vin Diesel', 'Samantha Vincent', 'Vince Totino', 'Scott Hemming', 'Ric Kidney', 'Gloria Borders', 'Zack Roth'], 'Starring': ['Vin Diesel', 'Donnie Yen', 'Deepika Padukone']} kudos for re-ingniting this bag of turds & accomplishing double douche-bag pre-emptive vomit launch. Everybody justs sleepwalks thru this entire flick. And for Vin before I even cash my check on a mish mash script effectively kills any chance for another sequel for this franchise not that it matters. This franchise deserved a better send off than this. Makes watching paint dry exciting again. And we have cgi over kill and cinema verde' waste of talent. massive pile of turds doing a double ollie & back flip {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Français (Canada)', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Français (France)'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Español (Latinoamérica) [CC]', 'Español (España) [CC]', 'Suomi', 'Français [CC]', 'Italiano [CC]', 'Nederlands [CC]', 'Nynorsk', 'Polski', 'Português [SDH]', 'Svenska'], 'Directors': ['Jon Turteltaub'], 'Producers': ['Gerald R. Molen', 'Wayne Wei Jiang', 'Randy Greenberg', 'Catherine Xujun Ying', 'Chantal Nong', 'Barrie M. Osborne', 'Belle Avery', 'Colin Wilson', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura'], 'Starring': ['Jason Statham', 'Rainn Wilson', 'Ruby Rose'], 'Studio': ['WARNER HOME VIDEO']} sh*t tiered cgi effects, along with lazy throw everything at the wall script leaves the cast almost sleep walking thru this aquamarine turd fest. From uninspired acting, editing and camera work - not even biggest shark ever to grace the screen can make this made for big screen in & out over the weekend 153 plus minute waste of humanity float.
Do yourself a favor & watch paint dry for better entertainment value. absolute turd pile {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Vizcarra'], 'Producers': ['Victor Vizcarra', 'Michael Vizcarra'], 'Starring': ['Larry Poole', 'Victor Vizcarra', 'Murphy Neal Jones']} There was no chance of winning in SE Asia period. From even Pentagons own study , known as Pentagon Papers which examined the US role from 1945 -1967' in the area the real reason for the US involvement in Vietnam was to contain China expanision . One of three fronts long-run effort to contain China (realizing that the USSR "contains" China on the north and northwest):
(a) the Japan–Korea front;
(b) the India–Pakistan front; and
(c) the Southeast Asia front.
The fantasy put forth by political bias in this film is the same insanity that brought the US to bomb Laos, Cambodia & expand the war into US politics that made Watergate topple the Nixon administration in it's pursiut for fatally flawed foriegn & domestic policy. Thud Pilots in a massive steamy Dud movie {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Neil Hollander', 'Rick Gordon', 'Mark H Tuttle'], 'Producers': ['Peter Maris', 'Donna K Tuttle', 'Mark H Tuttle'], 'Starring': ['Neil Armstrong']} First off Neil Armstrong is a god. Awesome narration. But this aviation series suffers major flaws , mistakes in so many areas it would take pages just to list. So for example lets look at episode 13 that centers on jets. The myth that german aviation specifically the TA -183 heavily influenced the Mig-15 . MiG-15 is merely a progression of the MiG-9 using information that was generally understood after the WWII. The MiG-9 was developed before any of the Ta-183 data was avalible and Ta-183's key feature was the high T-tail which was also its greatest short coming. The design history of the MiG-15 is available from the Mikoyan OKB Archives. English-language secondary sources include Mikoyan OKB by Bill Gunston, Soviet Secret Projects (Fighters) by Tony Buttler and MiG-15 by Yefim Gordon. All the authors are internationally respected and authoritative sources and all have concluded that the Ta-183 and MiG-15 are not related. Incidently in Tony Buttler's book he reveals that one rejected layout for the MiG-15 had forward-swept wings. another aviation series with some major flaws {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Various'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Lee', 'Peter Read'], 'Studio': ['HDP']} The 2nd Film is a horror gem from1964 - Dementia 13' and is Francis Ford Coppola's first flick, his directorial debut. Yeah, that's right. The man that brought you Apocalypse Now and The Godfather worked first in horror. Under rated horror gems The Shepherd Drama, Faith and Spirituality, Easygoing, Tense ['Exciting "top gun" action and conflict in the lives of the men who push the edge of danger defending our skies.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Donald W. Thompson'], 'Producers': ['Donald W. Thompson', 'Peg Courter', 'Russell S. Doughten Jr.'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Stone', 'Dee Wallace', 'Pepper Martin']} The box art cover is a instant classic. A pilot in full flight suit holding a lamb. Supersonic good clean fun with jets & explosion & stuff. Instant tear jerker. And lambs. nothing to do with interspecies sex {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Xiao Feng'], 'Producers': ['Benjamen Chen', 'Stephen J. Eads', 'Haiyang Jiang', 'Jian-Xiang Shi'], 'Starring': ['Bruce Willis', 'Ye Liu', 'Adrien Brody'], 'Studio': ['tribecashortlist']} And Bruce Willis sleepwalks thru this mess for a paycheck - so much cgi is thrown at the screen it overpowers what little screen writing, drama that remains. Besides the japanese fighter zero did not make it first flight until April 1939' was not deployed to China until 1940' in very small numbers with the 12th Rengo Kōkūtai . Dog fighting scenes are wasted with over the top cgi mish mash. Best to watch this with eyes closed & fast asleep for desired effect. thumbs down. air turd {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Fedor Bondarchuk'], 'Producers': ['Fedor Bondarchuk', 'Aleksandr Andryushchenko', 'Michael Kitaev', 'Elena Nelidova', 'Dmitriy Rudovskiy', 'Alina Tyazhlova', 'Mikhail Vrubel', 'Anton Zlatopolskiy'], 'Starring': ['Irina Starshenbaum', 'Alexander Petrov', 'Rinal Mukhametov'], 'Studio': ['Dark Sky Films']} Already re-gurgitated alien invasion genre & theme flogged to death. Sleep induced script & snail mail delivered acting topped off with shit tiered english delivery by a cast of unknowns. CGI efx cannot save this steamy pile of excrement. another sci fi turdfest
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Overall Sentiment:** The user remains highly critical of films that fail to deliver quality, particularly within the science fiction genre, which they feel has been overexposed. Their disdain for poorly executed narratives is evident in their recent review, marking a continuation of their strong negative sentiment towards unsatisfactory storytelling.

- **Rating Pattern:** Consistent with previous behavior, the user gave a particularly harsh rating to a recent sci-fi film, showcasing their intolerance for low-quality execution. This illustrates their established pattern of rating poorly crafted films severely, regardless of genre.

- **Content Preferences:** The user emphasizes the importance of engaging storytelling and strong performances. They exhibit an acute sensitivity to clichés and a distaste for films heavily reliant on CGI at the expense of substance, as highlighted in their latest critique.

- **Themes:** The user disapproves of uninspired scripts and mediocre acting, especially in projects that are perceived as derivative. Recent commentary underscores their frustration with the predictability and lack of originality in the sci-fi realm, reinforcing their critical perspective on conventional tropes.

- **Community Engagement:** The user actively shares their sharp critiques, advocating for meaningful storytelling while maintaining a wry humor. They continue to grapple with franchise fatigue and historical inaccuracies, marking an ongoing journey of navigating the landscape of film and entertainment with a discerning eye.
